newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria drags Vienna market down in wake.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria drags Vienna market down in wake.

text.p: Austria's ATX index ended 0.12 percent down on Friday as Bank Austria preference stock skidded 5.4 percent and its ordinaries fell to a record low.
Traders traced Bank Austria's slump to an unexpectedly low issue price for almost eight million new preference shares and a political spat over the bank's planned privatisation.
Bank Austria preferred finished 22.5 schillings down at 393.5 on unusually high turnover of 142,357 lots. Its ordinary shares were eight schillings down at a life-low of 757.
"It's not surprising to see the price come off," said an analyst, who saw room for further declines in both stocks.
Earlier Bank Austria announced it had priced its new preference shares at 376 schillings each. Politicians continued to trade blows over a rights deal with German WestLB.
Preferred shares in Creditansatlt, taken over by Bank Austria in January, weakened 2.7 schillings to 478.
The overall market held up relatively well, however, supported by demand for high-grade steelmaker Boehler-Uddeholm and engineering group VA Technologie AG.
The ATX index closed 1.57 points lower at 1,305.35, with eight shares up, 12 down and one unchanged.
"This week we have consolidated the 1,300-points level, paving the way for a positive development next week," a trader said.
Boehler was the top percentage gainer, up 13 schillings or 1.42 percent to 967 schillings. VA Tech advanced 28 schillings to 2,170.
June ATX futures closed one point down at 1,307 on turnover of 608 lots. The broad-based Vienna bourse index shed 0.54 points to 478.62.
